title: Persian Fairy Tales
description: Presents twenty-five fairy tales of ancient Persia about minarets and sultans, djinns and demons. Contents include: The Gardener and the Little Bird / The Hidden Treasure / The Story of King Jemshed / The Man Whose Luck Was Asleep / The Story of the Evil King Zohar / The Girl In the Golden Lampstand / The Envious Vizier / Irij and His Two Wicked Brothers / The Poor Man Who Became a Fortune-Teller / Zal and the Wonder-Bird / The Blind Beggar / How Rustem Became the Hero of Persia / The King Who Learned a Trade / The Poor Man and the Prophet Khizr / How Rustem Slew the White Demon / Rustem and Sohrab / The End of Afrasiyab / The Independent Man / Byzun and Manijeh / The Kazi π and the Merchant's Wife / The Vizier's Son and the Beautiful Slave-Girl / The Greedy Servant and His Lust for Gold / Isfendiyar and the Seven Stages / The Sultan and the Pious Baker / The Three Wicked Women.
author: Eleanor Brockett
